fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine is causing monkeypox
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is no evidence that monkeypox is linked to the widespread distribution of the Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Study comparing side effects of Covid-19 and vaccines nothing to do with WHO
fact_check_explanation_summary: Some experts have also raised questions about the study itself, which has been shared thousands of times on social media.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Keir Starmer tried to block the prosecution of Muslim grooming gangs
fact_check_explanation_summary: Widely-shared posts on Facebook make an unsubstantiated claim about Mr Starmer’s work for the Crown Prosecution Service.

fact_check_explanation_title: Tumours are not ‘there to save your life’
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post which claims cancer is ‘created’ by doctors performing needle biopsies on tumours and that it can be starved by natural remedies is inaccurate and potentially harmful.

fact_check_explanation_title: The World Economic Forum has not planned for a future without pets or animal charities
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post claims that the WEF has said there will be no need for animal charities in the future as people won’t have pets or eat meat. It hasn’t …

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Mel Gibson claimed Hollywood elites drink ‘baby blood’
fact_check_explanation_summary: Quotes about a conspiracy theory claiming Hollywood elites drink baby blood have been wrongly attributed to the actor.

fact_check_explanation_title: BBC Conservative leadership debate: Rishi Sunak and Liz Truss fact checked
fact_check_explanation_summary: We’ve taken a closer look at the claims made by the final two contenders to be the next Prime Minister.

fact_check_explanation_title: Did the heatwave see London Fire Brigade’s busiest day since WWII?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The claim was repeated by Sadiq Khan and subsequently reported around the world.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence Covid-19 vaccines causing heart attacks in children
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post misleadingly suggests that the vaccines are causing all sorts of previously rare health problems, including heart attacks in children.

fact_check_explanation_title: ‘Sky News’ screenshot linking vaccines with climate change is a fake
fact_check_explanation_summary: The broadcaster never published an article claiming that people should get vaccinated to beat climate change.

fact_check_explanation_title: Zara hasn’t banned women wearing hijab from its stores
fact_check_explanation_summary: The claim has been reshared on social media after first going viral in 2015.

fact_check_explanation_title: Murder of grandmother didn’t take place in UK, or in 2022
fact_check_explanation_summary: Dorothy Dow’s murder has been the subject of misinformation in the past.
